description: Search and analyze U.S. case law across thousands of courts using CourtListener’s open database. Find precedents, read full opinions, validate citations, study judge patterns, and check procedural requirements and legal trends. Search federal dockets, track case status, and analyze case timelines and documents when available.

courtlistener_api_key.description: CourtListener API key for enhanced access

tools.name: search_cases_by_problem
tools.description: Find relevant cases using LLM-generated search keywords. The LLM should extract legal keywords from the problem description and provide them for precise case law search.

jurisdiction.description:
Jurisdiction to search. Options:
                  - "all" (search all courts)
                  - "federal" (all federal courts)
                  - "state" (all state courts)
                  - "federal-bankruptcy" (bankruptcy courts)
                  - "military" (military courts)
                  - State names: "california", "texas", "florida", etc.
                  - Specific court IDs: "scotus", "ca9", "ca11", etc.
                  - Multiple courts: "ca9,ca11,scotus" (comma-separated)

problem_summary.description: Brief summary of the legal problem for context (1-2 sentences)

search_keywords.description: Array of legal search terms extracted by LLM from problem description (e.g., ["breach of contract", "negligence", "damages"])

tools.name: get_case_details
tools.description: Deep dive into specific case for precedent analysis with full legal reasoning

case_id.description: Case ID from search results (cluster ID or docket ID)

content_mode.description: Content mode: 'summary' returns API syllabus or 'N/A - use full mode', 'full' returns complete opinion text

tools.name: find_similar_precedents
tools.description: Find cases with similar legal reasoning or outcomes to a reference case

limit.description: Number of similar cases to return (1-15)

jurisdiction.description:
Jurisdiction to search for similar cases. Options:
                  - "all" (search all courts)
                  - "federal" (all federal courts)
                  - "state" (all state courts)
                  - State names: "california", "texas", "florida", etc.
                  - Specific court IDs: "scotus", "ca9", "ca11", etc.
                  - Multiple courts: "ca9,ca11,scotus" (comma-separated)

legal_concepts.description: Key legal concepts to match (e.g., ["breach of contract", "negligence"])

reference_case_id.description: ID of base case to find similar cases

citation_threshold.description: Minimum citation count for authoritative cases

tools.name: analyze_case_outcomes
tools.description: Analyze outcome patterns for similar cases to predict success likelihood

case_type.description: Type of legal issue to analyze

jurisdiction.description:
Jurisdiction to analyze cases in. Options:
                  - "all" (analyze all courts)
                  - "federal" (all federal courts)
                  - "state" (all state courts)
                  - State names: "california", "new-york", "texas", etc.
                  - Specific court IDs: "scotus", "ca9", "cal", etc.

tools.name: get_judge_analysis
tools.description: Analyze judge's typical rulings on similar issues for strategic insights

court.description: Specific court identifier (optional, narrows down the search)

case_type.description: Area of law to analyze (e.g., contract disputes, small claims, employment law)

jurisdiction.description:
Optional jurisdiction to help identify the correct judge. Options:
                  - "federal" (all federal courts)
                  - "state" (all state courts)
                  - State names: "california", "texas", "florida", etc.
                  - Specific court IDs: "scotus", "ca9", "ca11", etc.
                  Helps disambiguate common judge names.

tools.name: validate_citations
tools.description: Verify and expand legal citations with related case discovery

citations.description: List of citations to verify (e.g., ["123 F.3d 456", "Smith v. Jones"])

context_text.description: Surrounding legal argument context for better validation

jurisdiction.description:
Optional jurisdiction to improve search accuracy. Options:
                  - "federal" (all federal courts)
                  - "state" (all state courts)
                  - State names: "california", "texas", "florida", etc.
                  - Specific court IDs: "scotus", "ca9", "ca11", etc.
                  If omitted, searches all courts.

tools.name: get_procedural_requirements
tools.description: Find procedural rules and filing requirements for specific case types in any jurisdiction

court.description: Specific court identifier (optional, narrows down the search)

case_type.description: Type of legal complaint or case

claim_amount.description: Dollar amount of dispute (helps determine appropriate court level)

jurisdiction.description:
Jurisdiction to search for procedural requirements. Options:
                  - "federal" (all federal courts)
                  - "state" (all state courts)
                  - State names: "california", "new-york", "texas", etc.
                  - Specific court IDs: "scotus", "ca9", "cal", etc.

tools.name: track_legal_trends
tools.description: Identify recent trends in similar cases for strategic advantage

legal_area.description: Area of law to analyze trends

tools.name: search_pacer_dockets
tools.description: 📊 PACER SEARCH: Search federal court dockets from PACER via CourtListener's RECAP Archive. Find active and terminated cases with comprehensive party, attorney, and filing information. Search by case name, party name, or nature of suit across all federal courts or specific jurisdictions.

court.description: Specific court identifier (e.g., 'ca3', 'cacd', 'nysd', 'dcd') OR jurisdiction name (e.g., 'federal', 'california', 'bankruptcy'). Court IDs are passed directly, jurisdiction names are resolved to multiple courts.

limit.description: Maximum number of dockets to return

case_name.description: Case name or title to search for

case_type.description: Type of case to search for

date_range.description: Date range for case filing or termination dates

party_name.description: Name of a party involved in the case (plaintiff, defendant, etc.). Examples: 'Sean Combs', 'Microsoft Corporation', 'United States'

nature_of_suit.description: Nature of suit code or description (e.g., 'Contract', 'Tort', 'Civil Rights')

tools.name: get_docket_entries
tools.description: 🔒 PREMIUM ACCESS REQUIRED | EXPERIMENTAL: Get detailed docket entries for a specific case, including all filings, orders, and document references from PACER. Note: This function requires CourtListener premium API access and is experimental - may not work with basic API keys.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to return

entry_type.description: Type of docket entries to retrieve

tools.name: search_parties_attorneys
tools.description: 📊 BASIC ACCESS: Search for parties and attorneys across PACER cases. Track representation patterns and attorney success rates. Note: Basic API access provides limited data - premium access required for full attorney/party details.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

firm_name.description: Law firm name to search for

party_name.description: Name of party to search for (plaintiff, defendant, etc.)

tools.name: analyze_case_timeline
tools.description: 🔒 PREMIUM ACCESS REQUIRED | EXPERIMENTAL: Analyze case progression timeline from PACER docket entries. Track delays, activity patterns, and case development. Note: Requires premium access to docket-entries endpoint - basic API access provides limited timeline data only.

analysis_type.description: Type of timeline analysis to perform

include_documents.description: Include document filing analysis in timeline

tools.name: track_case_status
tools.description: 📊 BASIC ACCESS: Track current status and recent activity for PACER cases. Monitor active litigation progress. Note: Basic access provides case metadata only - premium access required for detailed activity tracking.

include_recent_activity.description: Include recent docket activity in status report

tools.name: get_case_documents
tools.description: 🔒 PREMIUM ACCESS REQUIRED | EXPERIMENTAL: Retrieve case documents from PACER with full text extraction. Access orders, motions, briefs, and opinions. Note: This function requires CourtListener premium API access and is experimental - may not work with basic API keys.

limit.description: Maximum number of documents to return

docket_id.description: Docket ID to get documents for

include_text.description: Include extracted full text content (may be large)
